author: Ashley Carman
description: Corsair is launching its first gaming chair today, and like most popular gaming chairs these days, it’s designed to look like it belongs in a racecar. The leather T1 Race apparently has arm rests...
title: Corsair is getting into the gaming chair market

title: Russian Magnate Sues AP Over Story on Trump Campaign Ties

author: By Andrew Levy For The Daily Mail
description: David Dee, who taught at Cedars Park Community Primary School in Suffolk, was arrested and charged with common assault after picking the girl up out of her chair when she refused to leave a lesson.
title: Headteacher wins three-year fight against unfair dismissal

author: Jim Michaels
description: Marine Gen. Joseph Dunford, chair of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, says NATO should be prepared to deploy additional forces if President Trump and other leaders agree to bolster the Afghanistan mission.
title: NATO in Afghanistan: Marine Gen. Joseph Dunford says alliance should move quickly to deploy forces

description: House Oversight Committee chair Jason Chaffetz sent a letter to acting FBI Director Andrew McCabe, asking for all FBI notes and information on James Comey's communications with President Trump
title: READ: Jason Chaffetz's letter to FBI

author: REBECCA SANTANA and KEVIN MCGILL
description: NEW ORLEANS (AP) — Workers in New Orleans took down a Confederate monument to Gen. P.G.T. Beauregard early Wednesday as onlookers watched from lawn chairs, while defiant statue supporters waved Confederate battle flags and opponents celebrated. It was the third of four such monuments to come down under a plan proposed by Mayor Mitch Landrieu and approved by the City Council more than a year ago. As with two earlier removals, it happened under cover of darkness. Work began soon after sundown and news outlets showed the statue being lifted off its base shortly after 3 a.m.
title: New Orleans takes down 3rd Confederate-era monument

description: MILWAUKEE (AP) — Storms whipped through a wide swath of the nation's midsection, giving rise to tornadoes that flattened a Wisconsin mobile home park and an Oklahoma subdivision and killing at least two people and injuring dozens of others. The storms hit Wisconsin late Tuesday afternoon and into the evening, leveling the Prairie Lake Estate Mobile Park near Chetek, which is about 110 miles (177 kilometers) northeast of Minneapolis. Mark Tyson said he and his wife Robin were huddled behind a living room chair as the storm hit Tuesday evening when an entire wall of their mobile home suddenly came flying at them.
title: Storms pummel central US, as tornadoes kill at least 2
